intro: Swertia erythraeae, commonly known as the Red Sea swertia, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has slender, branched stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Swertia erythraeae is often found in coastal areas and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
